name: code-levels
description: Adds various experience bars to track your coding progress

code-levels.caps.mainUser.description: Limits the display of user level on the tooltip, status bar and webview to this amount. Any number lower than 1 means no cap.

code-levels.caps.mainWorkspace.description: Limits the display of workspace level on the tooltip, status bar and webview to this amount. Any number lower than 1 means no cap.

code-levels.caps.userLanguage.description: Limits the display of user language level on the tooltip, status bar and webview to this amount. Any number lower than 1 means no cap.

code-levels.caps.workspaceLanguage.description: Limits the display of workspace language level on the tooltip, status bar and webview to this amount. Any number lower than 1 means no cap.

code-levels.grades.enableForUser.description: Translates levels to grades (i.e. Lv16 = B+) for the user level.

code-levels.grades.enableForUserLanguage.description: Translates levels to grades (i.e. Lv16 = B+) for the user language level.

code-levels.grades.enableForWorkspace.description: Translates levels to grades (i.e. Lv16 = B+) for the workspace level.

code-levels.grades.enableForWorkspaceLan.description: Translates levels to grades (i.e. Lv16 = B+) for the workspace language level.

code-levels.status.advancedBar.description: When enabled, replaces the simplistic bar with a more precise one. Causes the bar to shift around in width slightly, however.

code-levels.status.displayProgress.description: Shows progress to next level, as a bar, percentage, or nothing at all.

code-levels.status.displayPercentPrecisi.description: If Display Progress is set to Percent, this setting changes its precision in decimals + 1.

code-levels.status.displayExperienceType.description: Choose which experience type/level gets shown. Also affects on click view.

code-levels.status.levelDisplayType.description: Choose how the experience level should be shown.

code-levels.status.levelPercentPrecision.description: If Level Display Type is set to Percentage, this setting changes its precision in decimals + 1.

code-levels.status.levelReadySymbol.description: If enabled, shows a symbol next to the tooltip when saving would cause a level up.

code-levels.status.levelReadySymbolType.description: If Level Ready Symbol is on, this setting changes the symbol that appears.

code-levels.status.verticalBarFill.description: (Only works if Advanced Bar is enabled!) Changes each bar to fill vertically instead of horizontally.

code-levels.tooltip.enableTooltip.description: This setting enables or disables the tooltip in its entirety.

code-levels.tooltip.enableUser.description: Show quick information about the user by mousing over the status bar. Always hides if user tracking is disabled.

code-levels.tooltip.enableUserTotal.description: Show total experience points in the user part of the tooltip.

code-levels.tooltip.enableUserLanguage.description: Show brief user language level (+ progress in percentage) in the user part of the tooltip.

code-levels.tooltip.enableWorkspace.description: Show quick information about the workspace by mousing over the status bar.

code-levels.tooltip.enableWorkspaceTotal.description: Show total experience points in the workspace part of the tooltip.

code-levels.tooltip.enableWorkspaceLangu.description: Show brief workspace language level (+ progress in percentage) in the workspace part of the tooltip.

code-levels.tooltip.experienceSuffix.description: Change the suffix for point values seen at the tooltip. i.e. "340xp".

code-levels.user.name.markdownDescription: Determines what file it saves to. Converts to alphanumerics. Saved file is hard trimmed to 32 characters. **AUTOMATICALLY RELOADS AFTER CHANGING YOUR USERNAME.**

code-levels.user.tracking.description: Enables experience gain for the user.

code-levels.user.trackLanguage.description: Enables language-specific tracking for current user.

code-levels.user.levelMod.markdownDescription: Recommended value is 2x user language mod. The higher the value, the harder it is to increase user level. **Forces a level recalculation if changed.**

code-levels.user.levelModLanguage.markdownDescription: Recommended value is 0.5x user mod. The higher the value, the harder it is to increase user language level. **Forces a level recalculation if changed.**

code-levels.workspace.tracking.description: Enables experience gain for the workspace. Saves a dotfile (.clvls) in the root of the first workspace folder.

code-levels.workspace.trackLanguage.description: Enables language-specific tracking for current workspace. Saves to the dotfile (.clvls) in the root of the first workspace folder.

code-levels.workspace.levelMod.markdownDescription: Recommended value is 2x workspace language mod. The higher the value, the harder it is to increase workspace level. **Forces a level recalculation if changed.**

code-levels.workspace.levelModLanguage.markdownDescription: Recommended value is 0.5x workspace mod. The higher the value, the harder it is to increase workspace language level. **Forces a level recalculation if changed.**

code-levels.other.bigNumberFormat.description: Change the large number format to something else.

code-levels.other.barCommandsAffectWorks.description: As the name implies, any invoked commands would target workspace settings with this on.

code-levels.views.medalRequirementForUse.description: Amount of levels required to increase medal tier for main user level, in the user webview profile. Recommended value is 5. Any value lower than 0 disables this feature.
Amount of levels required to increase medal tier for each language level, in the user webview profile. Recommended value is 5. Any value lower than 0 disables this feature.

code-levels.views.medalRequirementForWor.description: Amount of levels required to increase medal tier for main workspace level, in the workspace webview profile. Recommended value is 5. Any value lower than 0 disables this feature.
Amount of levels required to increase medal tier for each language level, in the workspace webview profile. Recommended value is 5. Any value lower than 0 disables this feature.

code-levels.views.medalOffsetForUser.description: For the user level, shifts medal requirement by one (a req. of 5 means increasing in tier at 6, 11, 16, etc.). Great with grades enabled.

code-levels.views.medalOffsetForUserLang.description: For the workspace level, shifts medal requirement by one (a req. of 5 means increasing in tier at 6, 11, 16, etc.). Great with grades enabled.

code-levels.views.medalOffsetForWorkspac.description: For the workspace level, shifts medal requirement by one (a req. of 5 means increasing in tier at 6, 11, 16, etc.). Great with grades enabled.
For the user level, shifts medal requirement by one (a req. of 5 means increasing in tier at 6, 11, 16, etc.). Great with grades enabled.

code-levels.views.useAlternateStyle.description: Changes the styling in the webview to focus on bars instead of rings. Most noticeable while using languages.
